column1: Los Ángeles (Spanish pronunciation: [los ˈaŋxeles]) is the capital of the province of Bío Bío
column2: in the commune of the same name
column4: in the center-south of Chile. It is located between the Laja and Biobío rivers. The population is 186
column5: 671 inhabitants (census 2012). The municipality ("comuna") of Los Ángeles has the highest absolute rural population of any Chilean municipality.

column5: in the Andes mountain range. The city is a gateway for tourists visiting the nearby Laguna del Laja National Park

column1: Los Ángeles is served by María Dolores Airport.
Founded as Nuestra Señora de Los Ángeles (Our Lady of the Angels) in 1739 by José Antonio Manso de Velasco
column2: it was originally a Spanish fort as an outpost in the War of Arauco. It received the title of villa in 1748. The city underwent numerous rebuildings
column3: due to the Spanish military campaigns against the native Mapuche in their efforts to colonize the area. Its geographic location
column4: just to the north of the Biobío river (the border established by the Spaniards)

column1: This region experiences warm (but not hot) and dry summers
column2: with no average monthly temperatures above 71.6 °F. According to the Köppen Climate Classification system
column3: Los Ángeles has a warm-summer Mediterranean climate
column4: abbreviated "Csb" on climate maps. Most of the annual precipitation of 42 inches (1070 mm) falls during the autumn and winter months of April through September. May is the wettest month
column5: with 10 inches (250 mm) of precipitation on average. Snow is uncommon
column6: and when it falls melts quickly.

column2: Los Ángeles is a third-level administrative division of Chile administered by a municipal council
column3: headed by an alcalde who is directly elected every four years. The 2008-2012 alcalde is Joel Rosales Guzmán (UDI).Within the electoral divisions of Chile
column4: Los Ángeles is represented in the Chamber of Deputies by Juan Lobos (UDI) and José Pérez (PRSD) as part of the 47th electoral district
column14: Laja and Alto Bío Bío). The commune is represented in the Senate by Victor Pérez Varela (UDI) and Mariano Ruiz -Esquide Jara (PDC) as part of the 13th senatorial constituency (Biobío-Coast).
